channel.title: Quality3Ds Daily Pulse
channel.description: Curated daily news for 3D printing enthusiasts.

item.title: [2026-01-14] ?? Bambu Lab Awarded Patent for Intelligent Speed Adjustment
item.description: Bambu Lab continues to innovate with a new patent for an intelligent speed-adjusting method. This technology aims to automatically enhance print quality by adjusting parameters in real-time based on print conditions. Read more ? https://fabbaloo.com

item.title: [2026-01-14] ?? Kelowna Cancer Centre Personalizes Radiation with 3D Printing
item.description: Medical professionals in Kelowna are leveraging 3D printing to improve patient outcomes. The centre is using custom 3D-printed boluses to precisely personalize radiation therapy for cancer patients. Read more ? https://3dprintingindustry.com

item.title: [2026-01-14] ?? U.S. NDAA 2026 Targets Additive Manufacturing Supply Chain
item.description: The latest National Defense Authorization Act introduces new restrictions on 3D printing systems for defense. The act focuses on securing the supply chain by limiting procurement of systems tied to specific foreign entities. Read more ? https://3dprintingindustry.com

item.title: [2026-01-14] ?? 3D Printed Rammed Earth: A New Era for Sustainable Housing
item.description: Large-scale construction is looking to the past to build the future with rammed earth 3D printing. This technique combines one of humanity's oldest building materials with modern robotics for sustainable architecture. Read more ? https://fabbaloo.com

item.title: [2026-01-14] ?? Bambu Lab A1 Printers Empower Prosthetic Production in Guatemala
item.description: Brent Wright and the LifeEnabled foundation are bringing low-cost prosthetics to those in need. Utilizing a fleet of Bambu A1 printers, the team is producing functional prosthetic feet directly in the field. Read more ? https://3dprint.com

item.title: [2026-01-14] ?? MUHC Researchers Combine VR and 3D Printing for Lung Repair
item.description: Innovations in respiratory medicine are seeing the fusion of virtual reality and additive manufacturing. Researchers are testing these technologies to create more accurate models for complex lung repair procedures. Read more ? https://3dprintingindustry.com

item.title: [2026-01-14] ?? Hill Aerospace Museum Preserves History with 3D Scanning
item.description: Preserving historic aircraft has become more precise thanks to 3D technologies. The museum is using 3D scanning and printing to recreate missing or damaged parts for legendary planes. Read more ? https://3dprint.com
